config.question: Which of these best explains the Supreme Court’s decision to uphold the Wagner Act and Social Security?

choices.content: to defuse Roosevelt’s attack on the composition of the Court
to signal defiance to Roosevelt’s “court-packing” scheme
to show that it was still an independent body
to demonstrate approval for Roosevelt’s legislative agenda

answer_3.response: In the midst of the attempt to greatly expand the number of Supreme Court justices—an unprecedented attack on the Supreme Court—the Court gave its support to New Deal legislation. The best explanation for this support is that the Court hoped to placate Roosevelt.
